intro: Hieracium sparsum subsp. silesiacum, commonly known as the Silesian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. It is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
